title: 112_hr4118
content: The Act titled "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts. The Small Business Act is being amended to require the inclusion of small business concerns in multiple award contracts. The Small Business Act is amended to include small businesses in set-aside programs and agency outreach for multiple award contracts. The Small Business Act is amended to include a program to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts by raising awareness, providing education and training, assisting with contract listings, and tracking participation. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. Section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632) is amended to include various types of contracts such as contracts under the Federal Supply Schedule program, multi-agency contracts, and Government-wide acquisition contracts for information technology. The Small Business Act is amended to include contracts like Federal Supply Schedule program, multi-agency contracts, and Government-wide acquisition contracts for information technology. Additionally, definitions for Blanket Purchase Agreement and Basic Ordering Agreement are provided in the Act. SEC. 4. Ensuring small business participation in multiple award contracts, multi-agency contracts, and government-wide acquisition contracts. Section 15(g)(1) of the Small Business Act is amended to require the President to annually establish Government-wide goals for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to various small business concerns. The Small Business Act is amended to establish Government-wide goals for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to socially and economically disadvantaged individuals and small business concerns owned and controlled by women. SEC. 5. IMPROVEMENTS TO THE SMALL BUSINESS RESERVE. Section 15(j) of the Small Business Act is amended to increase the threshold from $100,000 to $200,000 and to include regulations for task or delivery orders placed against multiple award contracts, including those under the Federal Supply Schedule program. The Administrator will issue regulations within 120 days in consultation with the Administrator of General Services Administration. The Administrator of the General Services Administration will issue regulations to ensure correct size standards, implement non-manufacturer rule, and display accurate size information for small businesses in electronic ordering systems for task orders. SEC. 6. SMALL BUSINESS REPRESENTATION ON THE FEDERAL ACQUISITION REGULATORY COUNCIL. Amends Section 1302(b)(1) of title 41, United States Code to include the Administrator of the Small Business Administration on the council. In case of a tie vote, the Administrator of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy will have the deciding vote.
